title: Empirical Application Vignette
text: vignette illustrates stepdown procedure can applied real gene expression data identify transcripts associated cell cycle phases. use publicly available HeLa cell cycle data Hughes et al. (2009).

title: Empirical Application Vignette
text: Install load required packages: Load hdIndep package
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))   install.packages("BiocManager") BiocManager::install("GEOquery")  required_packages <- c("readxl", "compiler", "ggplot2") invisible(lapply(required_packages, require, character.only = TRUE)) library(hdIndep)

title: Empirical Application Vignette
text: analyze GEO dataset GSE11923: may download data HeLa Cell Cycle (Hughes et al. 2009) See information dataset : https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE11923 column expr_data corresponds sample (GSM ID=GEO Sample). row corresponds probe set measuring expression sample. values expr_data expression intensity values probe set sample.
code: gse <- GEOquery::getGEO("GSE11923", GSEMatrix = TRUE) expr_data <- exprs(gse[[1]])

title: Empirical Application Vignette
text: Define parameters stepdown procedure: Reshape data can run stepdown procedure automatically. Run stepdown procedure using BMB1 studentized version test statistic Collect variables screened stepdown procedure. probes independent cycle phase. Finally, save independent variables
code: n <- dim(expr_data)[2] # Sample size p <- dim(expr_data)[1] # Number of variables q <- block_size(n) # Block size B <- 1000 # Number of bootstrap replications alpha <- 0.05 # Significance level m <- floor(n / (q + 1)) # Number of blocks type <- "bmb1" # Test statistic used in the multiplier bootstrap # Set seed for reproducibility seed <- 5 set.seed(seed) D <- t(expr_data) dat <- list(X = seq(1, n, by = 1), D = D) stud <- stepdown_RomanoWolf(dat, q, B, alpha, type, seed, steps = TRUE) length(stud$rejected_total) # Number of rejected hypotheses length(stud$rejected_total) /  dim(expr_data)[1] stud$counter # Number of steps in the stepdown procedure independent_vars <- expr_data[stud_1$rejected_total, ] write.csv(independent_vars, file = "data/independent_vars.csv")

previous_headings: Comparing Results with Hughes et al. (2009)
what: Load the probes that were identified by Hughes et al. (2009).
title: Empirical Application Vignette
text: Download pre-processed data HeLa Cell Cycle Hughes et al. (2009), Table S1, Supporting information: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC2654964/#pgen.1000442.s012 excel file, pgen.1000442.s012.xls, contains transcripts identified Hughes et al. (2009) cycle period length 24 hrs, .e., independent cell cycle phase.
code: df_hughes <- readxl::read_excel("data/pgen.1000442.s012.xls", sheet = 1) hughes2009 <- df_hughes[[1]] # Extract identified probes as a vector cat("Hughes et al. (2009) identified", length(hughes2009), "different transcripts in mouse liver that cycle with a period length of 24 hours.\n")

previous_headings: Comparing Results with Hughes et al. (2009)
what: Compare transcripts from Hughes et al. (2009) with ours
title: Empirical Application Vignette
text: Extract first column Compare two sets identified transcripts
code:
raw_oow2025 <- read.csv("data/independent_vars.csv", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) oow2025 <- raw_oow2025[[1]]  # Extract identified probes as a vector cat("Our stepdown method identified", length(oow2025),     "different transcripts.
") common <- intersect(hughes2009, oow2025) unique_oow <- setdiff(oow2025, hughes2009) unique_hughes <- setdiff(hughes2009, oow2025) cat("There are", length(common), "transcripts that are common to both sets.
") cat("There are", length(unique_oow), "transcripts unique to our method.
")

title: Empirical Application Vignette
text: Take random sample unique transcripts identified procedure transcripts? Extract platform (GPL) ID Check platform ID download annotation file platform Extract annotation table check available column names Select relevant columns Match id_sample (probe set IDs) add original Probe Set IDs Print subset Replace id_sample Gene Symbols plots
code: cat("Here are 6 randomly selected transcripts identified by our procedure:\n") set.seed(6) id_sample <- sample(unique_oow, 6) gpl_id <- annotation(gse[[1]]) print(gpl_id) gpl <- getGEO(gpl_id) gpl_table <- Table(gpl) colnames(gpl_table) probe_to_gene <- gpl_table[, c("ID", "Gene Symbol", "Gene Title")] gene_info <- probe_to_gene[match(id_sample, probe_to_gene$ID), c("Gene Symbol", "Gene Title")] gene_info$ProbeSetID <- id_sample print(gene_info) id_sample_symbol <- gene_info$Gene.Symbol

title: Empirical Application Vignette
text: Convert raw_oow2025 matrix Find id_sample raw_oow2025 return columns data frame Visuals
code: raw_oow2025 <- as.matrix(raw_oow2025) id_sample_df <- raw_oow2025[raw_oow2025[, 1] %in% id_sample, ] plot_data <- apply(id_sample_df[, -1], 2, as.numeric) x_vals <- 1:ncol(plot_data)  for (i in 1:nrow(plot_data)) {   # Create a data frame for the current row   df <- data.frame(x = x_vals, y = plot_data[i, ])      # Generate plot   ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = y)) +     geom_line(linetype = "dashed") +  # Dashed line     geom_point(color = "skyblue") +      # Blue circles     theme_minimal() +                 # Minimal theme     labs(x = "Hour", y = "Intensity Level")  # Updated axis labels }

title: Bootstrap Test for Independence Testing in High Dimensions
text: Clone repo Open RStudio right panel new tab “Build” (next “Git”). Click Click Install button (Optional): -> Configure Build Tools -> Generate documentation Roxygen Alternatively: Clone repo Execute R console: Alternatively: Execute R console: successful installation, can use functions hdIndep repository usual package installed CRAN: can also run tiny simulation terminal (~10 seconds) verify running. Simply navigate base directory, .e., set working directory directory containing README, execute
code: install.packages(<path-to-cloned-repository>, repos=NULL) library(devtools) devtools::install_github("https://github.com/mauolivares/hdIndep.git") library(hdIndep) ?stepdown_RomanoWolf # Read the documentation stepdown_RomanoWolf(...) cd scripts Rscript tiny_simulation.r

title: Bootstrap Test for Independence Testing in High Dimensions
text: main functions used empirical applications stepdown_RomanoWolf.r BMB.cv.r. source files R/ directory. documentation read source files , installing hdIndep package, R typing, instance, ?stepdown_RomanoWolf, like usual functions. example usage whole workflow scripts/tiny_simulation.r.

title: Bootstrap Test for Independence Testing in High Dimensions
text: vignette vignettes/hdIndep.Rmd presents step--step guide proposed stepdown procedure. use data two sources: Hughes et al. (2009) collected liver tissue samples mice hourly intervals 48-hour period, pooling samples 3-5 mice point. data available Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO). paper, focus liver dataset (accession GSE11923). extracted data using GEOquery BiocManager R Packages. comparing transcripts identified method Hughes et al. (2009), use transcripts reported authors original study. data set available Hughes et al. (2009); see Table S1 Associated Data section paper. data set downloaded link https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC2654964/#s2 . final data set available data/pgen.1000442.s012.xls. Data Citation: Hughes, M. E., DiTacchio, L., Hayes, K. R., Vollmers, C., Pulivarthy, S., Baggs, J. E., Satchidananda, P. & Hogenesch, J. B. (2009). Harmonics circadian gene transcription mammals. PLoS genetics, 5(4), e1000442.

what: Calculates the Gaussian BMB critical value based on the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's correlation coefficients. — BMB.cv
title: Calculates the Gaussian BMB critical value based on the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's correlation coefficients. — BMB.cv
text: function returns bootstrap critical value statistic $$T^B=\max_{1\le j\le p}\frac{1}{\sqrt{mq}}\sum_{k=1}^{m} \hat{}_{j,k} \cdot \varepsilon_{k}$$ based \(B\) block multiplier bootstrap samples.

title: Calculates the Gaussian BMB critical value based on the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's correlation coefficients. — BMB.cv
code: BMB.cv(dat, q, B, alpha, type = c("bmb", "bmb1", "bmb2"), seed = NULL)

title: Calculates the Gaussian BMB critical value based on the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's correlation coefficients. — BMB.cv
text: dat Data frame. two elements data frame, X Y, X random variable Y corresponds \(Y_j\) individual hypothesis \(Y_j \perp X\). q Numeric. block size. B Numeric. number bootstrap samples. alpha Numeric. significance level. type Character. type test statistic calculated. Options "bmb", "bmb1", "bmb2", correspond \(\hat{T}^B\), \(\hat{T}^{B,stud1}\), \(\hat{T}^{B, stud2}\), respectively. See Olivares, Olma, Wilhelm (2025) details. seed Numeric. seed random number generator. NULL, seed set. positive integer, sets seed reproducibility.

title: Calculates the Gaussian BMB critical value based on the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's correlation coefficients. — BMB.cv
text: Returns list critical value type test statistic.

title: Calculates the Gaussian BMB critical value based on the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's correlation coefficients. — BMB.cv
text: Olivares, M., Olma, T., Wilhelm, D. (2025). Powerful Bootstrap Test Independence High Dimensions. Preprint, arXiv:2503.21715.

title: Calculates the Gaussian BMB critical value based on the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's correlation coefficients. — BMB.cv
text: Maurcio Olivares Tomasz Olma Daniel Wilhelm

title: Calculates the Gaussian BMB critical value based on the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's correlation coefficients. — BMB.cv
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ n <- 100 p <- 10 dat <- list() dat$X <- rnorm(n) dat$Y <- MASS::mvrnorm(n = n, mu = rep(0,  p), Sigma=diag(rep(1, p))) BMB.cv(dat, q=2, B=100, alpha=0.05, type = "bmb1", seed = 5)  } # }

what: Calculates the block-multiplier bootstrap test. — BMB_indep
title: Calculates the block-multiplier bootstrap test. — BMB_indep
text: function test \(H_{0,j}: Y_j \perp X\), \(j=1,\dots,p\) using block-multiplier bootstrap test Olivares, Olma, Wilhelm (2025).

title: Calculates the block-multiplier bootstrap test. — BMB_indep
code: BMB_indep(dat, B, alpha, type = c("bmb", "bmb1", "bmb2"), seed = NULL)

title: Calculates the block-multiplier bootstrap test. — BMB_indep
text: dat Data frame. two elements data frame, X Y, X random variable Y corresponds \(Y_j\) individual hypothesis \(Y_j \perp X\). B Numeric. number bootstrap samples. alpha Numeric. significance level. type Character. type test statistic calculated. Options "bmb", "bmb1", "bmb2", correspond \(\hat{T}^B\), \(\hat{T}^{B,stud1}\), \(\hat{T}^{B, stud2}\), respectively. See Olivares, Olma, Wilhelm (2025) details. seed Numeric. seed random number generator. NULL, seed set. positive integer, sets seed reproducibility.

title: Calculates the block-multiplier bootstrap test. — BMB_indep
text: object class "BMB_indep", list containing following components: type Type test Statistics. T_obs Test statistic. can one three options: BMB, BMB1, BMB2. See Olivares, Olma, Wilhelm (2025) details. n Sample Size. p Number hypotheses. block_size Block size used bootstrap. B Number bootstrap samples. cv Bootstrap critical value corresponding test statistic.

title: Calculates the block-multiplier bootstrap test. — BMB_indep
text: Olivares, M., Olma, T., Wilhelm, D. (2025). Powerful Bootstrap Test Independence High Dimensions. Preprint, arXiv:2503.21715.

title: Calculates the block-multiplier bootstrap test. — BMB_indep
text: Maurcio Olivares Tomasz Olma Daniel Wilhelm

title: Calculates the block-multiplier bootstrap test. — BMB_indep
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ n <- 100 p <- 10 dat <- list() dat$X <- rnorm(n) dat$Y <- MASS::mvrnorm(n = n, mu = rep(0,  p), Sigma=diag(rep(1, p))) test_indep <- BMB_indep(dat, B=100, alpha=0.05, type = "bmb1", seed = 5) summary(test_indep)  } # }

what: Calculates the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's rank correlation coefficients. — max.stat
title: Calculates the max-test statistic, where the maximum is taken over Chatterjee's rank correlation coefficients. — max.stat
text: function returns statistic $$\hat{T}=\sqrt{n}\max_{1\le j\le p}\hat{\xi}_j$$, \(\hat{\xi}_j\) Chatterjee's rank correlation coefficient \(j\)-th hypothesis. See Olivares, Olma, Wilhelm (2025) details.

title: Romano-Wolf Stepdown Method — stepdown_RomanoWolf
text: Consider family individual null hypotheses \(H_{0,j}: Y_j \perp X\), \(j=1,\dots,p\). function implements stepwise procedure selecting variables \(Y_1,\dots,Y_p\) violate independence, controlling family-wise error rate.

title: Romano-Wolf Stepdown Method — stepdown_RomanoWolf
code: stepdown_RomanoWolf(   dat,   q,   B,   alpha,   type = c("bmb", "bmb1", "bmb2"),   seed = NULL,   steps = FALSE )

title: Romano-Wolf Stepdown Method — stepdown_RomanoWolf
text: dat Data frame. two elements data frame, X Y, X random variable Y corresponds \(Y_j\) individual hypothesis \(Y_j \perp X\). q Numeric. block size block multiplier bootstrap. B Numeric. number bootstrap replications. alpha Numeric. significance level. type Character. type test statistic calculated. Options "bmb", "bmb1", "bmb2", correspond \(\hat{T}^B\), \(\hat{T}^{B,stud1}\), \(\hat{T}^{B, stud2}\), respectively. See Olivares, Olma, Wilhelm (2025) details. seed Numeric. seed random number generator. NULL, seed set. positive integer, sets seed reproducibility. steps Logical. TRUE, function return steps stepdown procedure. default FALSE.

title: Romano-Wolf Stepdown Method — stepdown_RomanoWolf
text: Returns list total number rejections. steps = TRUE, also return steps stepdown procedure.

title: Romano-Wolf Stepdown Method — stepdown_RomanoWolf
text: Olivares, M., Olma, T., Wilhelm, D. (2025). Powerful Bootstrap Test Independence High Dimensions. Preprint, arXiv:2503.21715.

title: Romano-Wolf Stepdown Method — stepdown_RomanoWolf
text: Maurcio Olivares Tomasz Olma Daniel Wilhelm

title: Summarizing Block Multiplier Bootstrap Test of Independence in High Dimensions. — summary.BMB_indep
text: summary_BMB_indep returns object class "summary.BMB_indep" following components results Matrix Testing Problem, Type Test Statistics, Test Statistics, Sample Size, Number Hypothesis, Significance Level, Block size, Number bootrap samples, Block-Multiplier-Bootstrap critical value.

title: Summarizing Block Multiplier Bootstrap Test of Independence in High Dimensions. — summary.BMB_indep
